t: Habakkuk 1
Chaldeans Used to Punish Judah
The*p oracle which Habakkuk the prophet saw.
How*pn long, O Lord,*s will I call for help, And*ln You will not hear? I*ln cry out to You, “Violence!” Yet*ln You do not save.
Why*ln do You make me see iniquity, And*ln cause me*i to look on wickedness? Yes,*ln destruction and violence are before me; Strife*ln exists and contention arises.
Therefore*ln the law is ignored And*ln justice is never upheld. For*ln the wicked surround the righteous; Therefore*ln justice comes out perverted.
“Look*ln among the nations! Observe! Be*ln astonished! Wonder! Because*ln I*i am*i doing something in your days— You*ln would not believe if you were told.
For*ln behold, I am raising up the Chaldeans, That*ln fierce and impetuous people Who*ln march throughout the earth To*ln seize dwelling places which are not theirs.
They*ln are dreaded and feared; Their*ln justice and authority originate with themselves.

Their*ln horses are swifter than leopards And*ln keener than wolves in the evening. Their*ln horsemen come galloping, Their*ln horsemen come from afar; They*ln fly like an eagle swooping down*i to devour.
All*ln of them come for violence. Their*ln horde of faces moves*i forward. They*ln collect captives like sand.
They*ln mock at kings And*ln rulers are a laughing matter to them. They*ln laugh at every fortress And*ln heap up rubble to capture it.
Then*ln they will sweep through like*i the wind and pass on. But*ln they will be held guilty, They*ln whose strength is their god.”
Are*ln You not from everlasting, O*ln Lord,*s my God, my Holy One? We*ln will not die. You,*ln O Lord,*s have appointed them to judge; And*ln You, O Rock, have established them to correct.

Your*iln eyes are too pure to approve evil, And*ln You can not look on wickedness with*i favor.*i Why*ln do You look with favor On*ln those who deal treacherously? Why*ln are You silent when the wicked swallow up Those*ln more righteous than they?
Why*iln have You made men like the fish of the sea, Like*ln creeping things without a ruler over them?
The*iln Chaldeans*i bring all of them up with a hook, Drag*ln them away with their net, And*ln gather them together in their fishing net. Therefore*ln they rejoice and are glad.
Therefore*ln they offer a sacrifice to their net And*ln burn incense to their fishing net; Because*ln through these things their catch is large, And*ln their food is plentiful.
Will*ln they therefore empty their net And*ln continually slay nations without sparing?
Habakkuk 2
God Answers the Prophet
I*pn will stand on my guard post And*ln station myself on the rampart; And*ln I will keep watch to see what He will speak to me, And*ln how I may reply when I am reproved.
Then*ln the Lord*s answered me and said, “Record*ln the vision And*ln inscribe it*i on tablets, That*ln the one who reads it may run.
For*ln the vision is yet for the appointed time; It*ln hastens toward the goal and it will not fail. Though*ln it tarries, wait for it; For*ln it will certainly come, it will not delay.
“Behold,*ln as for the proud one, His*ln soul is not right within him; But*ln the righteous will live by his faith.

Furthermore,*ln wine betrays the haughty man, So*ln that he does not stay at home. He*ln enlarges his appetite like Sheol, And*ln he is like death, never satisfied. He*ln also gathers to himself all nations And*ln collects to himself all peoples.

“Will*ln not all of these take up a taunt-song against him, Even*ln mockery and*i insinuations against him And*ln say, ‘Woe to him who increases what is not his— For*ln how long— And*ln makes himself rich with loans?’
Will*ln not your creditors rise up suddenly, And*ln those who collect from you awaken? Indeed,*ln you will become plunder for them.
Because*ln you have looted many nations, All*ln the remainder of the peoples will loot you— Because*ln of human bloodshed and violence done to the land, To*ln the town and all its inhabitants.
“Woe*ln to him who gets evil gain for his house To*ln put his nest on high, To*ln be delivered from the hand of calamity!
You*ln have devised a shameful thing for your house By*ln cutting off many peoples; So*ln you are sinning against yourself.
Surely*ln the stone will cry out from the wall, And*ln the rafter will answer it from the framework.
“Woe*ln to him who builds a city with bloodshed And*ln founds a town with violence!
Is*ln it not indeed from the Lord*s of hosts That*ln peoples toil for fire, And*ln nations grow weary for nothing?
For*ln the earth will be filled With*ln the knowledge of the glory of the Lord,*s As*ln the waters cover the sea.
“Woe*ln to you who make your neighbors drink, Who*ln mix in your venom even to make them*i drunk So*ln as to look on their nakedness!

You*ln will be filled with disgrace rather than honor. Now*ln you yourself drink and expose your own*i nakedness. The*ln cup in the Lord’s*s right hand will come around to you, And*ln utter disgrace will*i come*i upon your glory.

For*ln the violence done to Lebanon will overwhelm you, And*ln the devastation of its*i beasts by which you terrified them, Because*ln of human bloodshed and violence done to the land, To*ln the town and all its inhabitants.
“What*ln profit is the idol when its maker has carved it, Or*iln an image, a teacher of falsehood? For*ln its*i maker trusts in his own*i handiwork When*ln he fashions speechless idols.

Woe*ln to him who says to a piece*i of*i wood, ‘Awake!’ To*ln a mute stone, ‘Arise!’ And*iln that is your*i teacher? Behold,*ln it is overlaid with gold and silver, And*ln there is no breath at all inside it.
But*ln the Lord*s is in His holy temple. Let*ln all the earth be silent before Him.”
Habakkuk 3
God’s Deliverance of His People
A*p prayer of Habakkuk the prophet, according to Shigionoth.
Lord,*spn I have heard the report about You and*i I fear. O*ln Lord,*s revive Your work in the midst of the years, In*ln the midst of the years make it known; In*ln wrath remember mercy.
God*ln comes from Teman, And*ln the Holy One from Mount Paran. Selah. His*ln splendor covers the heavens, And*ln the earth is full of His praise.
His*iln radiance is like the sunlight; He*ln has rays flashing*i from His hand, And*ln there is the hiding of His power.
Before*ln Him goes pestilence, And*ln plague comes after Him.
He*ln stood and surveyed the earth; He*ln looked and startled the nations. Yes,*ln the perpetual mountains were shattered, The*ln ancient hills collapsed. His*ln ways are everlasting.
I*ln saw the tents of Cushan under distress, The*ln tent curtains of the land of Midian were trembling.
Did*ln the Lord*s rage against the rivers, Or*ln was*i Your anger against the rivers, Or*ln was*i Your wrath against the sea, That*ln You rode on Your horses, On*ln Your chariots of salvation?
Your*ln bow was made bare, The*ln rods of chastisement were sworn. Selah. You*ln cleaved the earth with rivers.
The*ln mountains saw You and*i quaked; The*ln downpour of waters swept by. The*ln deep uttered forth its voice, It*ln lifted high its hands.
Sun*ln and*i moon stood in their places; They*ln went away at the light of Your arrows, At*ln the radiance of Your gleaming spear.
In*ln indignation You marched through the earth; In*ln anger You trampled the nations.
You*ln went forth for the salvation of Your people, For*ln the salvation of Your anointed. You*ln struck the head of the house of the evil To*ln lay him open from thigh to neck. Selah.
You*ln pierced with his own spears The*ln head of his throngs. They*ln stormed in to scatter us; Their*ln exultation was*i like those Who*ln devour the oppressed in secret.
You*ln trampled on the sea with Your horses, On*ln the surge of many waters.

I*ln heard and my inward parts trembled, At*ln the sound my lips quivered. Decay*ln enters my bones, And*ln in my place I tremble. Because*ln I must wait quietly for the day of distress, For*ln the people to arise who*i will invade us.

Though*ln the fig tree should not blossom And*ln there be no fruit on the vines, Though*iln the yield of the olive should fail And*ln the fields produce no food, Though*ln the flock should be cut off from the fold And*ln there be no cattle in the stalls,
Yet*ln I will exult in the Lord,*s I*ln will rejoice in the God of my salvation.
The*ln Lord God*s is my strength, And*ln He has made my feet like hinds’ feet,*i And*ln makes me walk on my high places. For*p the choir director, on my stringed instruments.
